title: Maintaining Acceptable Water Pressure in Showerheads

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the repeal of a lengthy government regulation that defines the term "showerhead" in great detail, arguing that such overregulation harms the economy and personal freedom. Instead, it supports using a simple dictionary definition to describe showerheads and eliminates the related regulatory requirements.
potential_concerns: Repealing the detailed showerhead definition and related regulations may reduce federal oversight of water efficiency, potentially leading to higher water and energy consumption.
The order may limit the Department of Energy's ability to enforce standards designed to save energy and water resources.
Removing these regulations could lead to inconsistent product standards across states, causing market confusion for manufacturers and consumers.
The emphasis on deregulation may face criticism for prioritizing industry or personal freedom over environmental sustainability and conservation goals.
